title: FY2024 prisoner operations details

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FY2024 prisoner operations details
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

(1) any record(s) detailing the average daily population of all individuals remanded to the custody of the U.S. Marshals Service in FY 2025 (or most recent fiscal year for which records are available), disaggregated or broken down by:
(a) sex; 
(b) most serious offense or charge (if that is not possible, then by offense category, i.e. violent, property, drugs, other new offense, weapons, immigration, supervision, material witness, etc.); 
(c) case status (i.e., convicted or unconvicted, or sentenced or unsentenced); 
(d) both sex and most serious offense (or if that is not possible, then by offense category) – i.e., the number of females in custody for each offense type and the number of males in custody for each offense type;
(e) both sex and case status (convicted or unconvicted, or sentenced or unsentenced) – i.e. the number of females in custody who are sentenced versus unsentenced and the number of males in custody who are sentenced versus unsentenced; and
(f) type of facility (i.e., state correctional facility, local correctional facility, privately owned or operated facilities, Federal Bureau of Prisons facilities, hospitals, or other).

If records are unavailable for the average daily population, records reporting the same information for any single day after January 1, 2024 (or the most recent day for which records are available) would be acceptable. Similarly, I would prefer records that contain this information reported as counts (totals), but if such records are unavailable, records reporting the same information by percent (percent of total) would be acceptable. I would also prefer the information be sent via email in PDF format, but would accept other electronic formats. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

I agree to pay any reasonable copying and postage fees of not more than $25. If the cost would be greater than this amount, please notify me. Please provide a receipt indicating the charges for each document. 

If you choose to deny this request, please provide a written explanation for the denial, including a reference to the specific statutory exemption(s) upon which you rely. Also, please provide all segregable portions of otherwise exempt material.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Wendy Sawyer

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act and  Smithsonian Directive 807, I hereby request any and all records on Executive Order 14253 "Restoring Truth and Sanity to American History which was issued on March 27, 2025 and Department of the Interior  Secretary Order 3431 . I request any and all relevant records beginning on January 20, 2025 to the most recent records available. The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes therefore I request a waiver of any and all fees.

title: Untitled

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Untitled
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Daily snapshots of the Motor Carrier Census file (also known as Company Census or MCS-150 data) for the period January 1, 2000  through January 27, 2026.   If daily snapshots are not available, I would be interested in monthly or quarterly snapshots.  

Fields of interest (standard census fields):                                                                                                       
  - DOT_NUMBER                                                                                                                                       
  - LEGAL_NAME, DBA_NAME                                                                                                                             
  - PHY_STREET, PHY_CITY, PHY_STATE, PHY_ZIP                                                                                                         
  - NBR_POWER_UNIT (power units)                                                                                                                     
  - DRIVER_TOTAL (drivers)                                                                                                                           
  - MCS150_MILEAGE, MCS150_MILEAGE_YEAR                                                                                                              
  - CARRIER_OPERATION (interstate/intrastate)                                                                                                        
  - CARGO types (CRGO_* fields)                                                                                                                      
  - Authority status fields                                                                                                                          
  - MCS150_DATE (filing date)                                                                                                                        

Preferred format: CSV, pipe-delimited text, or any machine-readable format.                                                                        

Please note that this request has been made numerous times per a review of FOIA logs, specifically FMCS-2023-05358, FMCS-2023-03393, FMCS-2023-03511 in FY2023, and also in previous years.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ian White

title: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Sedgwick County Sheriff)

communications.subject: The Kansas Open Records Act Request: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Sedgwick County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Kansas Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2025. If possible, please provide this data in database or spreadsheet format and include the case number, incident date, incident time, subject injured indicator, subject injury force related info (e.g. Yes or No), subject age, subject gender, subject ethnicity, subject weapon type, incident area occurred, force type, officer division (e.g. law enforcement operations, detention/correctional operations, etc.), badge number and names associated with the officers involved. If one or more of these fields or dates is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If no database or spreadsheet format is available, please provide copies of each individual use of force report or other report where use of force information is documented/reported by officers. Note, this is for all use of force incidents reported by your agency, not limited to only those incidents required to be reported under state or federal programs.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samuel Sinyangwe

communications.subject: KORA Response re: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Sedgwick County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
Mr. Sinyangwe,

The appropriate email address for these requests is either sheriffrecords@sedgwick.gov<mailto:sheriffrecords@sedgwick.gov> or KORA-FIO@sedgwick.gov<mailto:KORA-FIO@sedgwick.gov>
The Finance Division, who you originally sent this to, cannot respond to your request.

I am forwarding to Sheriff Records. If you do not receive a response within three (3) business days, please let me know so I can troubleshoot.

[cid:image001.png@01DC9062.BA4C4E70]

Jennifer Scriven, MA | Records Manager & Freedom of Information Officer | Sedgwick County Department of Central Services

communications.subject: Nine Years Use Of Force Reports
communications.communication:
Hello,

We received your request for nine years' worth of incidents of Use of Force reported to the State of Wisconsin by the St. Croix County Sheriff's Office. This would include any incidents occurring in our jail. There is one Hammond Police Department incident mentioned that we cannot speak to. This is the only report that is already in existence bearing any assemblance of the information you have requested. You will notice it does not contain many of the fields you requested.

Pursuant to Wis Stat §19.35(1)(L) an authority is not required to create a new record by extracting information from existing records and compiling the information in a new format. The records you are requesting are not a record.

Please feel free to contact me with any questions regarding the above information. If you believe the St. Croix County Sheriff's Office is withholding the requested records, you may request the St. Croix County District Attorney or the Wisconsin Attorney General to commence an action for mandamus for release of the records on your behalf. Pursuant to Wis. Stats. § 19.37(1), you may also file an action for mandamus on your own behalf.

Thank you,


[cid:sheriffsiglogo2_1855255d-257b-4278-957c-61a991b79423.jpg]<https://sccwi.gov/>

Tammy Wanchena | Evidence and Records Custodian
St. Croix County Sheriff's Office
1101 Carmichael Rd Hudson WI 54016
T: 715-381-4333 | F: 715-381-4355

Tammy.Wanchena@sccwi.gov

<https://sccwi.gov/>

communications.communication:
Good afternoon, Samuel Sinyangwe.

The Highlands County S.O. does not maintain a listing containing the Use of Force data you have requested during the specified time frame. A manual review of reports would be conducted, and any accompanying Use of Force reports would be copied and provided.

The information is reported to the Florida Department of Law Enforcement. They may publish the data you seek on their website.

If you would like to proceed with copies of the Use of Force reports, please notify our Records Unit by email at Records@highlandssheriff.org.

They will prepare an estimated labor fee invoice for submission and pre-payment.

Thank you in advance for your time.

Respectfully Submitted,

Lizette "Liz" Peralta

Central Records Director

Records Management Liaison Officer

Highlands County Sheriff's Office

400 S. Eucalyptus Street

Sebring, Florida 33870



 [cid:fb087908-cea6-4777-bb51-43f2fe3886d3]

communications.subject: RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Santa Fe County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
VIA EMAIL

January 28, 2026

The New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act (IPRA) does not require public bodies to create new documents, compile data into new formats, or answer questions; it only mandates access to existing public records that are already maintained by the government entity, meaning they must provide what they have, not invent new records. IPRA ensures transparency by allowing access to official government affairs, but the obligation is to provide existing files, not generate reports or answers to complex queries.

Based on the specifics of NM IPRA law, there are no responsive documents for your request. There is not a tracking format in place to locate the information requested.

As of this writing we have completed and closed your request.

Thank you,
Athena Martinez

title: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Douglas County Sheriff)

communications.subject: Oregon Public Records Law Request: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Douglas County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Oregon Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2025. If possible, please provide this data in database or spreadsheet format and include the case number, incident date, incident time, subject injured indicator, subject injury force related info (e.g. Yes or No), subject age, subject gender, subject ethnicity, subject weapon type, incident area occurred, force type, officer division (e.g. law enforcement operations, detention/correctional operations, etc.), badge number and names associated with the officers involved. If one or more of these fields or dates is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If no database or spreadsheet format is available, please provide copies of each individual use of force report or other report where use of force information is documented/reported by officers. Note, this is for all use of force incidents reported by your agency, not limited to only those incidents required to be reported under state or federal programs.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Samuel Sinyangwe

communications.subject: RE: Oregon Public Records Law Request: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Douglas County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Sinyangwe,
Thank you for your email and public records request.  Your email was sent to the Douglas County Public Affairs Office for review. Our office manages the public records requests for most of Douglas County Government Departments.  However, the Douglas County Sheriff's Office (DCSO) has a separate process for public records requests regarding law enforcement documents.   Therefore, our office does not have access to the records you are requesting.

To request records from DCSO, you will need to complete and submit a request form directly to DCSO at DCSOinfo@douglascountyor.gov<mailto:DCSOinfo@douglascountyor.gov>.

Here is the link to the DCSO's Public Records Request submission form:
https://www.dcso.com/DocumentCenter/View/121/Records-Request-PDF

We have closed the request on our side.  Thank you and have a great day.

Sincerely,

[cid:image001.png@01DC904F.DB3CC000]
